qas.question: In Ireland what word is mainly used instead of university?
Spain refers to a university in what other way?
The nation of Ghana shortens university to what?
Scotland is said to frequently refer to university as what?
In what century was it believed that the UK used the word varsity to refer to a university?
In Scotland what word is mainly used instead of university?
Mexico refers to a university in what other way?
The nation of Congo shortens university to what?
In what century was it believed that France used the word varsity to refer to a university?
What has become uncommon in Australia?

context: Colloquially, the term university may be used to describe a phase in one's life: "When I was at university..." (in the United States and Ireland, <a0_0><b5_0>college<b5_0/><a0_0/> is often used instead: "When I was in college..."). In Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United Kingdom, Nigeria, the Netherlands, Spain and the German-speaking countries university is often contracted to <a1_0><b6_0>uni<b6_0/><a1_0/>. In Ghana, New Zealand and in South Africa it is sometimes called "<a2_0><b7_0><b9_0>varsity<b9_0/><b7_0/><a2_0/>" (although this has become uncommon in New Zealand in recent years). "Varsity" was also common usage in the UK in the <a4_0><b8_0>19th<b8_0/><a4_0/> century.[citation needed] "<a3_0>Varsity<a3_0/>" is still in common usage in Scotland.
